ru.ispras.sedna.driver
Class DatabaseManager

java.lang.Object
  ru.ispras.sedna.driver.DatabaseManager

public class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object

To start working with Sedna application has to open a session via establishing an authenticated connection with the Sedna server. Use getConnection(String, String, String, String) method to open connections to one of the Sedna databases.

Method Detail

getConnection

public static SednaConnection getConnection(java.lang.String urlString,
                                            java.lang.String dbName,
                                            java.lang.String login,
                                            java.lang.String password)
                                     throws DriverException
Try to establish connection with the Sedna database server.

Parameters:
urlString - the name of the computer where the Sedna DBMS is running. This parameter may contain a port number. For example 127.0.0.1:6060 specifies that Sedna server is running on the localhost and listening on the TCP port 6060. If the port number is not specified, the default port number 5050 is used
dbName - the name of the database to connect to
login - user name
password - user password
Returns:
If the connection has been established and authentication succeeded the method returns an object that implements the SednaConnection interface
Throws:
DriverException - if failed to establish connection
See Also:
SednaConnection
